author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Pattali Makkal Katchi has promised to “reverse migration” to southern districts by creating more job opportunities in rural areas through industrialisation and attract investments to the farming sector.

Interacting with a cross section of people from Madurai, Virudhunagar and Ramanathapuram districts here on Tuesday, the party’s chief ministerial candidate Anbumani Ramadoss said more than 60 per cent of the industrial units in the State were located within the 100-km radius of Chennai; 15 per cent around Coimbatore district and the rest of the 25 were scattered across the State.

Lack of job opportunities was the root cause of a lot of problems, including caste clashes, he said. The two Dravidian parties that had ruled for five decades did not bother about the livelihood of the people, who were forced to migrate to the metropolis like Chennai, Bengaluru and Mumbai.

“By bringing in more industrial units here and through improved techniques of agriculture with additional investment by the government, we will create more job opportunities and bring back people who migrated from villages,” he said.
title: PMK for development of rural areas in south
